ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 11 Space Evironment Monitor Data, X-ray, Mag., Electrons & HEPAD, at 5 min Resolution
ResourceHeader.Description: This GOES 11 SEM  data set contains various parameters at 5 min resolution. Within the data files is the Xray flux for two wavelength ranges, the magnetic field vectors, the >2 MeV uncorrected elecron fluxes, and the uncorrected proton and alpha particle fluxes for several energy ranges.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NOAA Environmental Research Laboratories;  Dr. Terry Onsager;  Dr. Howard Singer;

InformationURL.Name: GOES 11 Space Enviroment Monitor
InformationURL.Description: Introduction to the GOES 11 space enviroment monitor.

InformationURL.Name: GOES 11 Space Environment Monitor
InformationURL.Description: Additional GOES Triaxial Fluxgate Magnetometer information.

InformationURL.Name: GOES 11 Triaxial Fluxgate Magnetometer Example ASCII file
InformationURL.Description: Additional GOES Triaxial Fluxgate Magnetometer header information.

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 11 SEM data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 11 SEM data in ASCII format as well as the energetic particle data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, A0558606.FIT indicates the type of particle data (A) for spacecraft 5 (05) at 5 min resolution (5) from June 1986 (8606).

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: NOAA Environmental Research Laboratories;  Dr. Terry Onsager; Dr. Howard Singer;

TimeSpan.Note: Time format in data files is YYMMDD HHMM DOY (2 digit year, 2 digit month, 2 digit day, 2 digit hour, 2 digit minute, and 3 digit day of year.

Parameter.Name: Date and Time
Parameter.Description: Time is given in 3 columns. Time format in data files is YYMMDD HHMM DOY (2 digit year, 2 digit month, 2 digit day, 2 digit hour, 2 digit minute, and 3 digit day of year.

Element.Name: Year Month Day (2 digit year, 2 digit month, 2 digit day)
Hour Minute (2 digit hour, 2 digit min)

Parameter.Name: Solar X-Ray Monitor
Parameter.Description: Solar X-Ray monitor flux in Two different wavelength ranges in units of Watts/Meter^2.

Structure.Description: Solar X-ray monitor fluxes from two wavelength ranges: 1-8 Ang and .5-4 Ang.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Sensor Magnetic Field Vectors at 5 min Resolution Data in Spacecraft Coordinates
Parameter.Description: Magnetic field vector in spacecraft coordinates in units of 0.1 nT. The values must be divided by a factor of 10 to nT. HP  is parallel to the satellite spin axis, which is itself: perpendicular to the satellite's orbital plane.  HE lies parallel: to the satellite-earth center line and points earthward.  HN is: perpendicular to both HP and HE, and points eastward.

Structure.Description: HP  is parallel to the satellite spin axis, which is itself: perpendicular to the satellite's orbital plane. HE lies parallel: to the satellite-earth center line and points earthward. HN is: perpendicular to both HP and HE, and points eastward.

Parameter.Name: 2 MeV electrons
Parameter.Description: Uncorrected >=2 MeV electrons number fluxes in units of (Counts/cm2 sec sr). These values are especially unreliable during ion storms.

Parameter.Name: Uncorrected Protons and Alpha Particles
Parameter.Description: Uncorrected proton and alpha particle number fluxes in units of Counts/cm2 sec sr MeV for 6 different energy channels.

Structure.Description: Each Name provides the energy range for each channel.

Element.Name: 350 - 420 MeV protons (Counts/cm2 sec sr MeV) Uncorrected
420 - 510 MeV protons (Counts/cm2 sec sr MeV) Uncorrected
510 - 700 MeV protons (Counts/cm2 sec sr MeV) Uncorrected
>700 MeV protons (Counts/cm2 sec sr MeV) Uncorrected
2560 - 3400 MeV alpha-particles (Counts/cm2 sec sr MeV) Uncorrected
> 3400 MeV alpha-particles (Counts/cm2 sec sr MeV) Uncorrected
